byline.contributor: Nick Madigan and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

abstract: Bernie Sanders has largely kept his Jewish identity in background during 2016 presidential bid, complicating way in which some Jews view his candidacy; Sanders is historically far more focused on social justice than religious observance.
lead_paragraph: Bernie Sanders emphasizes his secular image, not his Jewish identity, complicating the way American Jews regard the historic nature of his candidacy.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Is Jewish, but He Doesn’t Like to Talk About It
headline.print_headline: Sanders’s Jewish Roots Stay in the Background on the Campaign Trail

snippet: Bernie Sanders emphasizes his secular image, not his Jewish identity, complicating the way American Jews regard the historic nature of his candidacy.
